Old movies and Robert Redford. Perfect!

I really like this set. I do however wish that a different movie would have been in this set other than Indecent Proposal. I could just not see not getting this set of movies, since it was only $5. Jeremiah Johnson is one of my favorite "westerns," if you would call it that. I also love the stories behind most of Robert Redfords movies. Such as Jeremiah Johbson not being released until 3 years after it was made for various reasons, as well as most of the people dropping out of the movie before production started.
4for the price of1 is awesome. awesome classics.
A great collection. 4 in the same space as 1.
Good product, fast shipper.

I can watch Robert Redford anytime.  He is such a great actor.  That is a huge compliment as in the 40's-50's the great actors and/or actesses' were Stars.  He is a star in today's element. Can watch over and over again.
A1
Some definite slow-moving, meaningful stories although "Presidents Men" is not. The photography was spectacular outdoors in particular. A great price if you are a Redford fan!
verry pleasedv

They were good
ok
Redford films great in a convenient package.  I love that you can purchase several of your favourites together.

I have watched and rewatched ATPM over and over to finally get all the dialogue that I missed watching it on commercial TV and such.  The other three are on my watch list near the top so I will be enjoying movies I missed and now can enjoy at my leisure.
I got this mainly for "The Great Gatsby" but enjoyed the other 3 movies also.  Great price for 4 movies and the picture & sound quality was outstanding.
Great buy
Product was as advertised,  good deal highly recommend
Can't go wrong with this purchase all in together, great shows
Great.
My Fav movies. Love it!
Arrived as promised. Product as described.
I love it
Pretty good movies
Good movies.
Robert Redford is ALWAYS 5 Stars! Love the Original Great Gatsby!

Except for All the President's men, which was excellent, and the same for Jeremiah Johnson,, I had not seen the other two.

I found Great Gatsby to be heart breaking in a way that we don't see in film today.
I was a little annoyed by seeing the sweat dripping on everyone's forehead; I realize it was supposed to emphasize the humidity of the emotional story as well as the setting, but I don't feel that it added to the story; it was distracting, although I felt for the actors having to wear so much flouncy clothing.
It provided a lot of insight into that era and the distance between rich and poor, and Nick, the character portrayed by Sam Waterston was a perfect foil for that message.

Indecent Proposal is a movie I was not prepared to like, but when Redford came on the scene the story shifted
and deepened.
I didn't like the often obvious repetition of the tag line Did I ever tell you I loved you?
I realize that the film hinged on that line.
I appreciate a that ponders human conditions and makes us ask questions.
I found myself caring that the couple squandered their 25 K when I would have stopped there.
I liked this film less than the others, but it did pose a philosophical question.
Just felt a little gimmicky.
Kind of like what we have now on TV: What would you do?
Moore and Harrelson gave it their all. .
  .
thanks
This was a great value.  The "Jeremiah Johnson" disc not only hade the ENTIRE movie but even had the Overture included. Loved it!
A gift for my wife who has named children after Redford.  Made me a popular husband, so was worth it....
good value dvd pack.  buy it especially if you're a redford fan.  i think "all the presidents" dvd is $10 play alone elsewhere.

My wife was in Washington DC when Robert Redford was making the movie
All the President's Men. She was just a child then. But since she has been a devoted
Robert Redford Follower. We see all his movies
WHATS NOT TO LOVE ABOUT ANYTHING ROBERT REDFORD!  FOUR GREAT FILMS AND A GREAT PRICE.
Wonderful classics

What a deal ! After seeing The Post last week, this four pack of Redford greats was a fine way to review " what happened next" in the saga of The Washington Post. Long ago I had seen All the Presidents' Men, but watching it  again after Hanks' portrayal of Ben Bradley made for intriguing comparisons. Jeremiah Johnson for the husband and the Great Gatsby for me were just nice bonuses. Thanks.
